Browse the source code of netbsd/external/lgpl3/mpfr/dist/src/sub1.c

1/* mpfr_sub1 -- internal function to perform a "real" subtraction
2
3Copyright 2001-2018 Free Software Foundation, Inc.
4Contributed by the AriC and Caramba projects, INRIA.
5
6This file is part of the GNU MPFR Library.
7
8The GNU MPFR Library is free software; you can redistribute it and/or modify
9it under the terms of the GNU Lesser General Public License as published by
10the Free Software Foundation; either version 3 of the License, or (at your
11option) any later version.
12
13The GNU MPFR Library is distributed in the hope that it will be useful, but
14WITHOUT ANY WARRANTY; without even the implied warranty of MERCHANTABILITY
15or FITNESS FOR A PARTICULAR PURPOSE. See the GNU Lesser General Public
16License for more details.
17
18You should have received a copy of the GNU Lesser General Public License
19along with the GNU MPFR Library; see the file COPYING.LESSER. If not, see
20http://www.gnu.org/licenses/ or write to the Free Software Foundation, Inc.,
2151 Franklin St, Fifth Floor, Boston, MA 02110-1301, USA. */
22
23#include "mpfr-impl.h"
24
25/* compute sign(b) * (|b| - |c|), with |b| > |c|, diff_exp = EXP(b) - EXP(c)
26 Returns 0 iff result is exact,
27 a negative value when the result is less than the exact value,
28 a positive value otherwise.
29*/
30
31/* TODO: check the code in case exp_b == MPFR_EXP_MAX. */
32
33int
34mpfr_sub1 (mpfr_ptr a, mpfr_srcptr b, mpfr_srcptr c, mpfr_rnd_t rnd_mode)
35{
36 int sign;
37 mpfr_exp_t diff_exp, exp_a, exp_b;
38 mpfr_prec_t cancel, cancel1;
39 mp_size_t cancel2, an, bn, cn, cn0;
40 mp_limb_t *ap, *bp, *cp;
41 mp_limb_t carry, bb, cc;
42 mpfr_prec_t aq, bq;
43 int inexact, shift_b, shift_c, add_exp = 0;
44 int cmp_low = 0; /* used for rounding to nearest: 0 if low(b) = low(c),
45 negative if low(b) < low(c), positive if low(b) > low(c) */
46 int sh, k;
47 MPFR_TMP_DECL(marker);
48
49 MPFR_TMP_MARK(marker);
50 ap = MPFR_MANT(a);
51 an = MPFR_LIMB_SIZE(a);
52
53 (void) MPFR_GET_PREC (a);
54 (void) MPFR_GET_PREC (b);
55 (void) MPFR_GET_PREC (c);
56
57 sign = mpfr_cmp2 (b, c, &cancel);
58 if (MPFR_UNLIKELY(sign == 0))
59 {
60 if (rnd_mode == MPFR_RNDD)
61 MPFR_SET_NEG (a);
62 else
63 MPFR_SET_POS (a);
64 MPFR_SET_ZERO (a);
65 MPFR_RET (0);
66 }
67
68 /*
69 * If subtraction: sign(a) = sign * sign(b)
70 * If addition: sign(a) = sign of the larger argument in absolute value.
71 *
72 * Both cases can be simplified in:
73 * if (sign>0)
74 * if addition: sign(a) = sign * sign(b) = sign(b)
75 * if subtraction, b is greater, so sign(a) = sign(b)
76 * else
77 * if subtraction, sign(a) = - sign(b)
78 * if addition, sign(a) = sign(c) (since c is greater)
79 * But if it is an addition, sign(b) and sign(c) are opposed!
80 * So sign(a) = - sign(b)
81 */
82
83 if (sign < 0) /* swap b and c so that |b| > |c| */
84 {
85 mpfr_srcptr t;
86 MPFR_SET_OPPOSITE_SIGN (a,b);
87 t = b; b = c; c = t;
88 }
89 else
90 MPFR_SET_SAME_SIGN (a,b);
91
92 if (MPFR_UNLIKELY (MPFR_IS_UBF (b) || MPFR_IS_UBF (c)))
93 {
94 exp_b = MPFR_IS_UBF (b) ?
95 mpfr_ubf_zexp2exp (MPFR_ZEXP (b)) : MPFR_GET_EXP (b);
96 diff_exp = mpfr_ubf_diff_exp (b, c);
97 }
98 else
99 {
100 exp_b = MPFR_GET_EXP (b);
101 diff_exp = exp_b - MPFR_GET_EXP (c);
102 }
103 MPFR_ASSERTD (diff_exp >= 0);
104
105 aq = MPFR_GET_PREC (a);
106 bq = MPFR_GET_PREC (b);
107
108 /* Check if c is too small.
109 A more precise test is to replace 2 by
110 (rnd == MPFR_RNDN) + mpfr_power2_raw (b)
111 but it is more expensive and not very useful */
112 if (MPFR_UNLIKELY (MAX (aq, bq) + 2 <= diff_exp))
113 {
114 MPFR_LOG_MSG (("case c small\n", 0));
115
116 /* Remember, we can't have an exact result! */
117 /* A.AAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAA
118 = B.BBBBBBBBBBBBBBB
119 - C.CCCCCCCCCCCCC */
120 /* A = S*ABS(B) +/- ulp(a) */
121
122 /* since we can't have an exact result, for RNDF we can truncate b */
123 if (rnd_mode == MPFR_RNDF)
124 return mpfr_set4 (a, b, MPFR_RNDZ, MPFR_SIGN (a));
125
126 MPFR_EXP (a) = exp_b; /* may be up to MPFR_EXP_MAX */
127 MPFR_RNDRAW_EVEN (inexact, a, MPFR_MANT (b), bq,
128 rnd_mode, MPFR_SIGN (a),
129 if (MPFR_EXP (a) != MPFR_EXP_MAX)
130 ++ MPFR_EXP (a));
131 MPFR_LOG_MSG (("inexact=%d\n", inexact));
132 if (inexact == 0)
133 {
134 /* a = b, but the exact value of b - c is a bit below. Then,
135 except for directed rounding similar to toward zero and
136 before overflow checking: a is the correctly rounded value
137 and since |b| - |c| < |a|, the ternary value value is given
138 by the sign of a. */
139 if (! MPFR_IS_LIKE_RNDZ (rnd_mode, MPFR_IS_NEG (a)))
140 {
141 inexact = MPFR_INT_SIGN (a);
142 goto check_overflow;
143 }
144 }
145 else /* inexact != 0 */
146 {
147 /* A.AAAAAAAAAAAAAA
148 = B.BBBBBBBBBBBBBBB
149 - C.CCCCCCCCCCCCC */
150 /* It isn't exact, so PREC(b) > PREC(a) and the last
151 PREC(b)-PREC(a) bits of b are not all zeros.
152 Subtracting c from b will not have an effect on the rounding
153 except in case of a midpoint in the round-to-nearest mode,
154 when the even rounding was done away from zero instead of
155 toward zero.
156 In case of even rounding:
157 1.BBBBBBBBBBBBBx10
158 - 1.CCCCCCCCCCCC
159 = 1.BBBBBBBBBBBBBx01 Rounded to PREC(b)
160 = 1.BBBBBBBBBBBBBx Nearest / Rounded to PREC(a)
161 Set gives:
162 1.BBBBBBBBBBBBB0 if inexact == EVEN_INEX (x == 0)
163 1.BBBBBBBBBBBBB1+1 if inexact == -EVEN_INEX (x == 1)
164 which means we get a wrong rounded result if x == 1,
165 i.e. inexact == MPFR_EVEN_INEX (for positive numbers). */
166 if (MPFR_LIKELY (inexact != MPFR_EVEN_INEX * MPFR_INT_SIGN (a)))
167 goto check_overflow;
168 }
169 /* We need to take the value preceding |a|. We can't use
170 mpfr_nexttozero due to a possible out-of-range exponent.
171 But this will allow us to have more specific code. */
172 MPFR_LOG_MSG (("correcting the value of a\n", 0));
173 sh = (mpfr_prec_t) an * GMP_NUMB_BITS - aq;
174 mpn_sub_1 (ap, ap, an, MPFR_LIMB_ONE << sh);
175 if (MPFR_UNLIKELY (MPFR_LIMB_MSB (ap[an-1]) == 0))
176 {
177 MPFR_EXP (a) --;
178 /* The following is valid whether an = 1 or an > 1. */
179 ap[an-1] |= MPFR_LIMB_HIGHBIT;
180 }
181 inexact = - MPFR_INT_SIGN (a);
182 check_overflow:
183 if (MPFR_UNLIKELY (MPFR_EXP (a) > __gmpfr_emax))
184 return mpfr_overflow (a, rnd_mode, MPFR_SIGN (a));
185 else
186 MPFR_RET (inexact);
187 }
188
189 /* reserve a space to store b aligned with the result, i.e. shifted by
190 (-cancel) % GMP_NUMB_BITS to the right */
191 bn = MPFR_LIMB_SIZE (b);
192 MPFR_UNSIGNED_MINUS_MODULO (shift_b, cancel);
193 cancel1 = (cancel + shift_b) / GMP_NUMB_BITS;
194
195 /* the high cancel1 limbs from b should not be taken into account */
196 if (MPFR_UNLIKELY (shift_b == 0))
197 {
198 bp = MPFR_MANT(b); /* no need of an extra space */
199 /* Ensure ap != bp */
200 if (MPFR_UNLIKELY (ap == bp))
201 {
202 bp = MPFR_TMP_LIMBS_ALLOC (bn);
203 MPN_COPY (bp, ap, bn);
204 }
205 }
206 else
207 {
208 bp = MPFR_TMP_LIMBS_ALLOC (bn + 1);
209 bp[0] = mpn_rshift (bp + 1, MPFR_MANT(b), bn++, shift_b);
210 }
211
212 /* reserve a space to store c aligned with the result, i.e. shifted by
213 (diff_exp-cancel) % GMP_NUMB_BITS to the right */
214 cn = MPFR_LIMB_SIZE (c);
215 if (IS_POW2 (GMP_NUMB_BITS))
216 shift_c = ((mpfr_uexp_t) diff_exp - cancel) % GMP_NUMB_BITS;
217 else
218 {
219 /* The above operation does not work if diff_exp - cancel < 0. */
220 shift_c = diff_exp - (cancel % GMP_NUMB_BITS);
221 shift_c = (shift_c + GMP_NUMB_BITS) % GMP_NUMB_BITS;
222 }
223 MPFR_ASSERTD (shift_c >= 0 && shift_c < GMP_NUMB_BITS);
224
225 if (MPFR_UNLIKELY(shift_c == 0))
226 {
227 cp = MPFR_MANT(c);
228 /* Ensure ap != cp */
229 if (ap == cp)
230 {
231 cp = MPFR_TMP_LIMBS_ALLOC (cn);
232 MPN_COPY(cp, ap, cn);
233 }
234 }
235 else
236 {
237 cp = MPFR_TMP_LIMBS_ALLOC (cn + 1);
238 cp[0] = mpn_rshift (cp + 1, MPFR_MANT(c), cn++, shift_c);
239 }
240
241#if 0
242 MPFR_LOG_MSG (("rnd=%s shift_b=%d shift_c=%d diffexp=%" MPFR_EXP_FSPEC
243 "d\n", mpfr_print_rnd_mode (rnd_mode), shift_b, shift_c,
244 (mpfr_eexp_t) diff_exp));
245#endif
246
247 MPFR_ASSERTD (ap != cp);
248 MPFR_ASSERTD (bp != cp);
249
250 /* here we have shift_c = (diff_exp - cancel) % GMP_NUMB_BITS,
251 0 <= shift_c < GMP_NUMB_BITS
252 thus we want cancel2 = ceil((cancel - diff_exp) / GMP_NUMB_BITS) */
253
254 /* Possible optimization with a C99 compiler (i.e. well-defined
255 integer division): if MPFR_PREC_MAX is reduced to
256 ((mpfr_prec_t)((mpfr_uprec_t)(~(mpfr_uprec_t)0)>>1) - GMP_NUMB_BITS + 1)
257 and diff_exp is of type mpfr_exp_t (no need for mpfr_uexp_t, since
258 the sum or difference of 2 exponents must be representable, as used
259 by the multiplication code), then the computation of cancel2 could
260 be simplified to
261 cancel2 = (cancel - (diff_exp - shift_c)) / GMP_NUMB_BITS;
262 because cancel, diff_exp and shift_c are all nonnegative and
263 these variables are signed. */
264
265 MPFR_ASSERTD (cancel >= 0);
266 if (cancel >= diff_exp)
267 /* Note that cancel is signed and will be converted to mpfr_uexp_t
268 (type of diff_exp) in the expression below, so that this will
269 work even if cancel is very large and diff_exp = 0. */
270 cancel2 = (cancel - diff_exp + (GMP_NUMB_BITS - 1)) / GMP_NUMB_BITS;
271 else
272 cancel2 = - (mp_size_t) ((diff_exp - cancel) / GMP_NUMB_BITS);
273 /* the high cancel2 limbs from b should not be taken into account */
274#if 0
275 MPFR_LOG_MSG (("cancel=%Pd cancel1=%Pd cancel2=%Pd\n",
276 cancel, cancel1, cancel2));
277#endif
278
279 /* ap[an-1] ap[0]
280 <----------------+-----------|---->
281 <----------PREC(a)----------><-sh->
282 cancel1
283 limbs bp[bn-cancel1-1]
284 <--...-----><----------------+-----------+----------->
285 cancel2
286 limbs cp[cn-cancel2-1] cancel2 >= 0
287 <--...--><----------------+----------------+---------------->
288 (-cancel2) cancel2 < 0
289 limbs <----------------+---------------->
290 */
291
292 /* first part: put in ap[0..an-1] the value of high(b) - high(c),
293 where high(b) consists of the high an+cancel1 limbs of b,
294 and high(c) consists of the high an+cancel2 limbs of c.
295 */
296
297 /* copy high(b) into a */
298 if (MPFR_LIKELY(an + (mp_size_t) cancel1 <= bn))
299 /* a: <----------------+-----------|---->
300 b: <-----------------------------------------> */
301 MPN_COPY (ap, bp + bn - (an + cancel1), an);
302 else
303 /* a: <----------------+-----------|---->
304 b: <-------------------------> */
305 if ((mp_size_t) cancel1 < bn) /* otherwise b does not overlap with a */
306 {
307 MPN_ZERO (ap, an + cancel1 - bn);
308 MPN_COPY (ap + (an + cancel1 - bn), bp, bn - cancel1);
309 }
310 else
311 MPN_ZERO (ap, an);
312
313 /* subtract high(c) */
314 if (MPFR_LIKELY(an + cancel2 > 0)) /* otherwise c does not overlap with a */
315 {
316 mp_limb_t *ap2;
317
318 if (cancel2 >= 0)
319 {
320 if (an + cancel2 <= cn)
321 /* a: <----------------------------->
322 c: <-----------------------------------------> */
323 mpn_sub_n (ap, ap, cp + cn - (an + cancel2), an);
324 else
325 /* a: <---------------------------->
326 c: <-------------------------> */
327 {
328 ap2 = ap + an + (cancel2 - cn);
329 if (cn > cancel2)
330 mpn_sub_n (ap2, ap2, cp, cn - cancel2);
331 }
332 }
333 else /* cancel2 < 0 */
334 {
335 mp_limb_t borrow;
336
337 if (an + cancel2 <= cn)
338 /* a: <----------------------------->
339 c: <-----------------------------> */
340 borrow = mpn_sub_n (ap, ap, cp + cn - (an + cancel2),
341 an + cancel2);
342 else
343 /* a: <---------------------------->
344 c: <----------------> */
345 {
346 ap2 = ap + an + cancel2 - cn;
347 borrow = mpn_sub_n (ap2, ap2, cp, cn);
348 }
349 ap2 = ap + an + cancel2;
350 mpn_sub_1 (ap2, ap2, -cancel2, borrow);
351 }
352 }
353
354 /* now perform rounding */
355 sh = (mpfr_prec_t) an * GMP_NUMB_BITS - aq;
356 /* last unused bits from a */
357 carry = ap[0] & MPFR_LIMB_MASK (sh);
358 ap[0] -= carry;
359
360 if (rnd_mode == MPFR_RNDF)
361 {
362 inexact = 0;
363 /* truncating is always correct since -1 ulp < low(b) - low(c) < 1 ulp */
364 goto truncate;
365 }
366 else if (rnd_mode == MPFR_RNDN)
367 {
368 if (MPFR_LIKELY(sh))
369 {
370 /* can decide except when carry = 2^(sh-1) [middle]
371 or carry = 0 [truncate, but cannot decide inexact flag] */
372 if (carry > (MPFR_LIMB_ONE << (sh - 1)))
373 goto add_one_ulp;
374 else if ((0 < carry) && (carry < (MPFR_LIMB_ONE << (sh - 1))))
375 {
376 inexact = -1; /* result if smaller than exact value */
377 goto truncate;
378 }
379 /* now carry = 2^(sh-1), in which case cmp_low=2,
380 or carry = 0, in which case cmp_low=0 */
381 cmp_low = (carry == 0) ? 0 : 2;
382 }
383 }
384 else /* directed rounding: set rnd_mode to RNDZ iff toward zero */
385 {
386 if (MPFR_IS_RNDUTEST_OR_RNDDNOTTEST(rnd_mode, MPFR_IS_NEG(a)))
387 rnd_mode = MPFR_RNDZ;
388
389 if (carry)
390 {
391 if (rnd_mode == MPFR_RNDZ)
392 {
393 inexact = -1;
394 goto truncate;
395 }
396 else /* round away */
397 goto add_one_ulp;
398 }
399 }
400
401 /* we have to consider the low (bn - (an+cancel1)) limbs from b,
402 and the (cn - (an+cancel2)) limbs from c. */
403 bn -= an + cancel1;
404 cn0 = cn;
405 cn -= an + cancel2;
406
407#if 0
408 MPFR_LOG_MSG (("last sh=%d bits from a are %Mu, bn=%Pd, cn=%Pd\n",
409 sh, carry, (mpfr_prec_t) bn, (mpfr_prec_t) cn));
410#endif
411
412 /* for rounding to nearest, we couldn't conclude up to here in the following
413 cases:
414 1. sh = 0, then cmp_low=0: we can either truncate, subtract one ulp
415 or add one ulp: -1 ulp < low(b)-low(c) < 1 ulp
416 2. sh > 0 but the low sh bits from high(b)-high(c) equal 2^(sh-1):
417 -0.5 ulp <= -1/2^sh < low(b)-low(c)-0.5 < 1/2^sh <= 0.5 ulp
418 we can't decide the rounding, in that case cmp_low=2:
419 either we truncate and flag=-1, or we add one ulp and flag=1
420 3. the low sh>0 bits from high(b)-high(c) equal 0: we know we have to
421 truncate but we can't decide the ternary value, here cmp_low=0:
422 -0.5 ulp <= -1/2^sh < low(b)-low(c) < 1/2^sh <= 0.5 ulp
423 we always truncate and inexact can be any of -1,0,1
424 */
425
426 /* note: here cn might exceed cn0, in which case we consider a zero limb */
427 for (k = 0; (bn > 0) || (cn > 0); k = 1)
428 {
429 /* if cmp_low < 0, we know low(b) - low(c) < 0
430 if cmp_low > 0, we know low(b) - low(c) > 0
431 (more precisely if cmp_low = 2, low(b) - low(c) = 0.5 ulp so far)
432 if cmp_low = 0, so far low(b) - low(c) = 0 */
433
434 /* get next limbs */
435 bb = (bn > 0) ? bp[--bn] : 0;
436 if ((cn > 0) && (cn-- <= cn0))
437 cc = cp[cn];
438 else
439 cc = 0;
440
441 /* cmp_low compares low(b) and low(c) */
442 if (cmp_low == 0) /* case 1 or 3 */
443 cmp_low = (bb < cc) ? -2+k : (bb > cc) ? 1 : 0;
444
445 /* Case 1 for k=0 splits into 7 subcases:
446 1a: bb > cc + half
447 1b: bb = cc + half
448 1c: 0 < bb - cc < half
449 1d: bb = cc
450 1e: -half < bb - cc < 0
451 1f: bb - cc = -half
452 1g: bb - cc < -half
453
454 Case 2 splits into 3 subcases:
455 2a: bb > cc
456 2b: bb = cc
457 2c: bb < cc
458
459 Case 3 splits into 3 subcases:
460 3a: bb > cc
461 3b: bb = cc
462 3c: bb < cc
463 */
464
465 /* the case rounding to nearest with sh=0 is special since one couldn't
466 subtract above 1/2 ulp in the trailing limb of the result */
467 if (rnd_mode == MPFR_RNDN && sh == 0 && k == 0) /* case 1 for k=0 */
468 {
469 mp_limb_t half = MPFR_LIMB_HIGHBIT;
470
471 /* add one ulp if bb > cc + half
472 truncate if cc - half < bb < cc + half
473 sub one ulp if bb < cc - half
474 */
475
476 if (cmp_low < 0) /* bb < cc: -1 ulp < low(b) - low(c) < 0,
477 cases 1e, 1f and 1g */
478 {
479 if (cc >= half)
480 cc -= half;
481 else /* since bb < cc < half, bb+half < 2*half */
482 bb += half;
483 /* now we have bb < cc + half:
484 we have to subtract one ulp if bb < cc,
485 and truncate if bb > cc */
486 }
487 else if (cmp_low >= 0) /* bb >= cc, cases 1a to 1d */
488 {
489 if (cc < half)
490 cc += half;
491 else /* since bb >= cc >= half, bb - half >= 0 */
492 bb -= half;
493 /* now we have bb > cc - half: we have to add one ulp if bb > cc,
494 and truncate if bb < cc */
495 if (cmp_low > 0)
496 cmp_low = 2;
497 }
498 }
499
500#if 0
501 MPFR_LOG_MSG (("k=%d bb=%Mu cc=%Mu cmp_low=%d\n", k, bb, cc, cmp_low));
502#endif
503
504 if (cmp_low < 0) /* low(b) - low(c) < 0: either truncate or subtract
505 one ulp */
506 {
507 if (rnd_mode == MPFR_RNDZ)
508 goto sub_one_ulp; /* set inexact=-1 */
509 else if (rnd_mode != MPFR_RNDN) /* round away */
510 {
511 inexact = 1;
512 goto truncate;
513 }
514 else /* round to nearest */
515 {
516 /* If cmp_low < 0 and bb > cc, then -0.5 ulp < low(b)-low(c) < 0,
517 whatever the value of sh.
518 If sh>0, then cmp_low < 0 implies that the initial neglected
519 sh bits were 0 (otherwise cmp_low=2 initially), thus the
520 weight of the new bits is less than 0.5 ulp too.
521 If k > 0 (and sh=0) this means that either the first neglected
522 limbs bb and cc were equal (thus cmp_low was 0 for k=0),
523 or we had bb - cc = -0.5 ulp or 0.5 ulp.
524 The last case is not possible here since we would have
525 cmp_low > 0 which is sticky.
526 In the first case (where we have cmp_low = -1), we truncate,
527 whereas in the 2nd case we have cmp_low = -2 and we subtract
528 one ulp.
529 */
530 if (bb > cc || sh > 0 || cmp_low == -1)
531 { /* -0.5 ulp < low(b)-low(c) < 0,
532 bb > cc corresponds to cases 1e and 1f1
533 sh > 0 corresponds to cases 3c and 3b3
534 cmp_low = -1 corresponds to case 1d3 (also 3b3) */
535 inexact = 1;
536 goto truncate;
537 }
538 else if (bb < cc) /* here sh = 0 and low(b)-low(c) < -0.5 ulp,
539 this corresponds to cases 1g and 1f3 */
540 goto sub_one_ulp;
541 /* the only case where we can't conclude is sh=0 and bb=cc,
542 i.e., we have low(b) - low(c) = -0.5 ulp (up to now), thus
543 we don't know if we must truncate or subtract one ulp.
544 Note: for sh=0 we can't have low(b) - low(c) = -0.5 ulp up to
545 now, since low(b) - low(c) > 1/2^sh */
546 }
547 }
548 else if (cmp_low > 0) /* 0 < low(b) - low(c): either truncate or
549 add one ulp */
550 {
551 if (rnd_mode == MPFR_RNDZ)
552 {
553 inexact = -1;
554 goto truncate;
555 }
556 else if (rnd_mode != MPFR_RNDN) /* round away */
557 goto add_one_ulp;
558 else /* round to nearest */
559 {
560 if (bb > cc)
561 {
562 /* if sh=0, then bb>cc means that low(b)-low(c) > 0.5 ulp,
563 and similarly when cmp_low=2 */
564 if (cmp_low == 2) /* cases 1a, 1b1, 2a and 2b1 */
565 goto add_one_ulp;
566 /* sh > 0 and cmp_low > 0: this implies that the sh initial
567 neglected bits were 0, and the remaining low(b)-low(c)>0,
568 but its weight is less than 0.5 ulp */
569 else /* 0 < low(b) - low(c) < 0.5 ulp, this corresponds to
570 cases 3a, 1d1 and 3b1 */
571 {
572 inexact = -1;
573 goto truncate;
574 }
575 }
576 else if (bb < cc) /* 0 < low(b) - low(c) < 0.5 ulp, cases 1c,
577 1b3, 2b3 and 2c */
578 {
579 inexact = -1;
580 goto truncate;
581 }
582 /* the only case where we can't conclude is bb=cc, i.e.,
583 low(b) - low(c) = 0.5 ulp (up to now), thus we don't know
584 if we must truncate or add one ulp. */
585 }
586 }
587 /* after k=0, we cannot conclude in the following cases, we split them
588 according to the values of bb and cc for k=1:
589 1b. sh=0 and cmp_low = 1 and bb-cc = half [around 0.5 ulp]
590 1b1. bb > cc: add one ulp, inex = 1
591 1b2: bb = cc: cannot conclude
592 1b3: bb < cc: truncate, inex = -1
593 1d. sh=0 and cmp_low = 0 and bb-cc = 0 [around 0]
594 1d1: bb > cc: truncate, inex = -1
595 1d2: bb = cc: cannot conclude
596 1d3: bb < cc: truncate, inex = +1
597 1f. sh=0 and cmp_low = -1 and bb-cc = -half [around -0.5 ulp]
598 1f1: bb > cc: truncate, inex = +1
599 1f2: bb = cc: cannot conclude
600 1f3: bb < cc: sub one ulp, inex = -1
601 2b. sh > 0 and cmp_low = 2 and bb=cc [around 0.5 ulp]
602 2b1. bb > cc: add one ulp, inex = 1
603 2b2: bb = cc: cannot conclude
604 2b3: bb < cc: truncate, inex = -1
605 3b. sh > 0 and cmp_low = 0 [around 0]
606 3b1. bb > cc: truncate, inex = -1
607 3b2: bb = cc: cannot conclude
608 3b3: bb < cc: truncate, inex = +1
609 */
610 }
611
612 if ((rnd_mode == MPFR_RNDN) && cmp_low != 0)
613 {
614 /* even rounding rule */
615 if ((ap[0] >> sh) & 1)
616 {
617 if (cmp_low < 0)
618 goto sub_one_ulp;
619 else
620 goto add_one_ulp;
621 }
622 else
623 inexact = (cmp_low > 0) ? -1 : 1;
624 }
625 else
626 inexact = 0;
627 goto truncate;
628
629 sub_one_ulp: /* sub one unit in last place to a */
630 mpn_sub_1 (ap, ap, an, MPFR_LIMB_ONE << sh);
631 inexact = -1;
632 goto end_of_sub;
633
634 add_one_ulp: /* add one unit in last place to a */
635 if (MPFR_UNLIKELY(mpn_add_1 (ap, ap, an, MPFR_LIMB_ONE << sh)))
636 /* result is a power of 2: 11111111111111 + 1 = 1000000000000000 */
637 {
638 ap[an-1] = MPFR_LIMB_HIGHBIT;
639 add_exp = 1;
640 }
641 inexact = 1; /* result larger than exact value */
642
643 truncate:
644 if (MPFR_UNLIKELY((ap[an-1] >> (GMP_NUMB_BITS - 1)) == 0))
645 /* case 1 - epsilon */
646 {
647 ap[an-1] = MPFR_LIMB_HIGHBIT;
648 add_exp = 1;
649 }
650
651 end_of_sub:
652 /* we have to set MPFR_EXP(a) to MPFR_EXP(b) - cancel + add_exp, taking
653 care of underflows/overflows in that computation, and of the allowed
654 exponent range */
655 MPFR_TMP_FREE (marker);
656 if (MPFR_LIKELY(cancel))
657 {
658 cancel -= add_exp; /* OK: add_exp is an int equal to 0 or 1 */
659 exp_a = exp_b - cancel;
660 /* The following assertion corresponds to a limitation of the MPFR
661 implementation. It may fail with a 32-bit ABI and huge precisions,
662 but this is practically impossible with a 64-bit ABI. This kind
663 of issue is not specific to this function. */
664 MPFR_ASSERTN (exp_b != MPFR_EXP_MAX || exp_a > __gmpfr_emax);
665 if (MPFR_UNLIKELY (exp_a < __gmpfr_emin))
666 {
667 underflow:
668 if (rnd_mode == MPFR_RNDN &&
669 (exp_a < __gmpfr_emin - 1 ||
670 (inexact >= 0 && mpfr_powerof2_raw (a))))
671 rnd_mode = MPFR_RNDZ;
672 return mpfr_underflow (a, rnd_mode, MPFR_SIGN(a));
673 }
674 if (MPFR_UNLIKELY (exp_a > __gmpfr_emax))
675 {
676 return mpfr_overflow (a, rnd_mode, MPFR_SIGN (a));
677 }
678 }
679 else /* cancel = 0: MPFR_EXP(a) <- MPFR_EXP(b) + add_exp */
680 {
681
682 /* in case cancel = 0, add_exp can still be 1, in case b is just
683 below a power of two, c is very small, prec(a) < prec(b),
684 and rnd=away or nearest */
685 MPFR_ASSERTD (add_exp == 0 || add_exp == 1);
686 /* Overflow iff exp_b + add_exp > __gmpfr_emax in Z, but we do
687 a subtraction below to avoid a potential integer overflow in
688 the case exp_b == MPFR_EXP_MAX. */
689 if (MPFR_UNLIKELY (exp_b > __gmpfr_emax - add_exp))
690 {
691 return mpfr_overflow (a, rnd_mode, MPFR_SIGN (a));
692 }
693 exp_a = exp_b + add_exp;
694 if (MPFR_UNLIKELY (exp_a < __gmpfr_emin))
695 goto underflow;
696 }
697 MPFR_SET_EXP (a, exp_a);
698 /* check that result is msb-normalized */
699 MPFR_ASSERTD(ap[an-1] > ~ap[an-1]);
700 MPFR_RET (inexact * MPFR_INT_SIGN (a));
701}
702
